title: Several killed in major Russian attack on Ukraine’s Kyiv
snippets: Russia bombed Ukraine’s capital Kyiv on Wednesday killing at least nine people and injuring dozens.
titles: Several killed in major Russian attack on Ukraine’s Kyiv
summary: On Wednesday, Russia launched an airstrike on Kyiv, Ukraine, resulting in at least nine fatalities and injuring dozens of individuals.

title: Kyiv hit by deadly Russian missile and drone attack - officials
snippets: At least nine people were killed and dozens injured in overnight Russian strikes on Ukraine's capital, officials say.
titles: Kyiv hit by deadly Russian missile and drone attack - officials
summary: Overnight Russian strikes on Ukraine's capital resulted in at least nine deaths and numerous injuries, according to officials.

title: ‘No mercy’: Israel keeps blocking aid amid systematic destruction of Gaza
snippets: Many women and children among 13 killed in the latest Israeli aerial attacks across Gaza.
titles: ‘No mercy’: Israel keeps blocking aid amid systematic destruction of Gaza
summary: In recent Israeli aerial strikes across Gaza, 13 individuals, including many women and children, were killed. This event marks the latest in a series of violent incidents affecting the region.

title: Vietnam, US kick off trade talks as Hanoi seeks relief from Trump’s tariffs
snippets: Trade-reliant Southeast Asian country is facing a 46 percent levy under Trump's so-called 'reciprocal' tariffs.
titles: Vietnam, US kick off trade talks as Hanoi seeks relief from Trump’s tariffs
summary: A Southeast Asian country, which relies heavily on trade, is now subject to a 46% tariff under President Trump's policy of 'reciprocal' tariffs. This move aims to equalize the trade balance but has raised concerns about its impact on the country's economy.

title: Deadly Kashmir attack risks India military escalation against Pakistan
snippets: India will respond but it's not clear how - or at what cost, experts say.
titles: Deadly Kashmir attack risks India military escalation against Pakistan
summary: Experts indicate that India plans to respond to an unspecified situation, but the details regarding the nature of the response and the potential costs involved remain unclear.

title: Exclusive: Arsenal on alert as unsettled Chelsea star made available for €45-50m
snippets: Arsenal are understood to be one of the clubs on alert for a surprise potential transfer raid on rivals Chelsea this summer.Sources have disclosed to CaughtOffside that Arsenal are interested in Andre...
titles: Exclusive: Arsenal on alert as unsettled Chelsea star made available for €45-50m
summary: Arsenal is reportedly interested in a potential transfer of Andre from Chelsea this summer, according to sources speaking with CaughtOffside. This move signals Arsenal's readiness to strengthen their squad by considering players from rival clubs.

title: House v. NCAA case: Judge threatens to reject settlement over roster limits, sets hard deadline
snippets: A federal judge issued a 14-day deadline for both parties to come to an agreement
titles: House v. NCAA case: Judge threatens to reject settlement over roster limits, sets hard deadline
summary: A federal judge has mandated that both involved parties must reach a settlement within a 14-day period. This directive aims to expedite the resolution process of the ongoing dispute, ensuring a timely conclusion.

title: Madrid face Copa crisis as Camavinga, Alaba hurt
snippets: Carlo Ancelotti admitted that it will be "difficult" for David Alaba and Eduardo Camavinga to be fit for Real Madrid's Copa del Rey final clash with Barcelona on Saturday, after both picked up injuries in Wednesday's 1-0 win at Getafe.
titles: Madrid face Copa crisis as Camavinga, Alaba hurt
summary: Carlo Ancelotti, Real Madrid's coach, stated that David Alaba and Eduardo Camavinga are unlikely to play in the upcoming Copa del Rey final against Barcelona due to injuries sustained during a 1-0 victory over Getafe on Wednesday.

title: Skier who crashed on N.H. mountain died ‘doing what he loved best’
snippets: A 39-year-old man who became the victim in a fatal skiing accident near the summit of Black Mountain Ski Area in New Hampshire died “doing what he loved best.”
titles: Skier who crashed on N.H. mountain died ‘doing what he loved best’
summary: A 39-year-old man died in a skiing accident near the summit of Black Mountain Ski Area in New Hampshire. The incident occurred while he was engaged in an activity he was passionate about.

title: The Athletic share new Marc Guiu injury update and detail Chelsea’s plan for the striker
snippets: Chelsea hope to have Marc Guiu back in May but are being extremely careful with the striker according to The Athletic.Guiu arrived at Chelsea from Barcelona last summer after the Blues activated the �...
titles: The Athletic share new Marc Guiu injury update and detail Chelsea’s plan for the striker
summary: Chelsea FC anticipates the return of striker Marc Guiu in May, following a careful approach to his recovery. Guiu, who transferred from Barcelona last summer after Chelsea activated his release clause, has been sidelined due to injury. The Athletic reports the club's cautious strategy in managing his rehabilitation to ensure a safe return to play.

title: Corporate America puts Wall Street on alert over damage from trade war
snippets: Executives use earnings calls to lay out costs and supply chain impacts from Donald Trump’s tariffs
titles: Corporate America puts Wall Street on alert over damage from trade war
summary: During earnings calls, executives have discussed the effects of tariffs implemented by Donald Trump's administration, focusing on increased costs and disruptions in the supply chain. These discussions aim to provide shareholders and analysts with insights into how the tariffs are impacting their businesses financially and operationally.

title: Revolut profits surge above £1bn on crypto trading boom
snippets: Profits at Europe’s most valuable start-up more than doubled in 2024 as it added 15mn customers
titles: Revolut profits surge above £1bn on crypto trading boom
summary: In 2024, Europe's most valuable startup saw its profits more than double, following the addition of 15 million customers. This significant growth underscores the company's expanding influence and success in its market sector.

title: Should corporate whistleblowers get paid?
snippets: Countries including the US, South Korea and Nigeria offer hefty rewards to insiders who uncover wrongdoing. Could the UK finally join them?
titles: Should corporate whistleblowers get paid?
summary: The UK is considering implementing a system similar to those in the US, South Korea, and Nigeria, where substantial financial rewards are offered to whistleblowers who expose wrongdoing. This move aims to encourage the uncovering of illegal or unethical activities by providing incentives to insiders who come forward with information.

title: The dollar has further to fall
snippets: Demand for US assets cannot keep up with supply without a weaker currency
titles: The dollar has further to fall
summary: The demand for U.S. assets is currently unable to match the supply without the devaluation of the currency. This situation implies that for equilibrium to be reached in the market, a weaker U.S. dollar is necessary to balance the levels of supply and demand for these assets.

title: Is this still the Asian century?
snippets: The theory is that hegemonies run in cycles, but Trump and a trade war may disrupt the pattern
titles: Is this still the Asian century?
summary: The theory suggests that global hegemonies operate in cyclical patterns. However, the potential disruption of this cycle is being attributed to Donald Trump's presidency and the initiation of trade wars. The current status or outcome of this disruption remains unspecified in the provided content.

title: Daily doses of peanuts could desensitise adults with the allergy
snippets: Exposing children with peanut allergy to proteins from the legume is an approved treatment to reduce the risk of allergic reactions, and now we have evidence it also works in adults
titles: Daily doses of peanuts could desensitise adults with the allergy
summary: A treatment that exposes individuals with peanut allergies to small amounts of peanut proteins, previously approved for children, has now been shown to effectively reduce the risk of allergic reactions in adults as well. This new evidence supports the treatment's use in a broader age range.

title: Can climate science attribute economic damage to major polluters?
snippets: Climate researchers argue their science has advanced enough to directly link emissions from particular companies to damages from specific extreme weather events
titles: Can climate science attribute economic damage to major polluters?
summary: Climate researchers have made advancements in their field, enabling them to directly connect emissions from specific companies to damages caused by particular extreme weather events. This development marks a significant step in understanding the impact of corporate actions on climate change.

title: First evidence of gladiator fight with lion seen in Roman-era skeleton
snippets: A man who lived in Roman-occupied Britain was bitten by a big cat, probably in a gladiator arena, an analysis of his remains has revealed
titles: First evidence of gladiator fight with lion seen in Roman-era skeleton
summary: An analysis of ancient remains has revealed that a man from Roman-occupied Britain was bitten by a big cat, likely in a gladiator arena. This finding provides insight into the types of encounters humans had with wild animals during that period.

title: Lyme disease treated with antibiotic that doesn't harm gut microbiome
snippets: Mice overcame a Lyme disease infection after being given an antibiotic that is often used for pneumonia, and its effect on their gut microbiomes was negligible
titles: Lyme disease treated with antibiotic that doesn't harm gut microbiome
summary: Mice infected with Lyme disease successfully recovered after being treated with an antibiotic commonly used for pneumonia. The treatment had minimal impact on their gut microbiomes.

title: Clinical trials to test vaccine against Alzheimer's-promoting tau protein
snippets: Researchers hope to launch human clinical trials in their quest for a vaccine to prevent the buildup of pathological tau after demonstrating that this vaccine generated a robust immune response in both mice and non-human primates.
titles: Clinical trials to test vaccine against Alzheimer's-promoting tau protein
summary: Researchers are preparing to start human clinical trials for a vaccine aimed at preventing the buildup of pathological tau, a protein linked to brain diseases. This decision follows successful tests where the vaccine elicited a strong immune response in mice and non-human primates, indicating potential effectiveness in humans.
